The patient has symptoms and findings consistent with Wilson's disease, which is an autosomal recessive genetic disorder that causes copper to accumulate in various organs, including the liver and brain. Penicillamine is an chelator agent used in the treatment of Wilson's disease to bind excess copper and remove it from the body.
